meeting_annotations.transcript: I would I would I would add sorry, I would add one you know, one little piece and some of you were in the other meeting, probably it sounds repeating. meeting_annotations.speaker: Gonzalo Vazquez-Prokopec (Emory)

So the whole ecology could change from the addition of a vector that is not necessarily even changing uh bringing its pathogen is actually changing the ecology of the pathogens uh that already circulate.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Gonzalo Vazquez-Prokopec (Emory)
meeting_annotations.transcript: And I think that's something that surveillance by focusing on on pathogen centric approach, we might be missing not only that, but also the linkage between the agricultural field, you know, Rift Valley and and these ones I mentioned you are really those that cross, you know, between two big bubbles that don't tend to interact much.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Kim Pepin, NWRC (USDA)
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I think that piece I think is fine. What I was getting at is like, what do you want to do with the surveillance data? Or other times we want to have a surveillance system because we want to be able to figure out how we're going to best respond when we get a detection or other times we want to be able to understand, you know, how is this pathogen transmitting? meeting_annotations.speaker: Christine K Johnson

meeting_annotations.speaker: Audrey Ruple, Virginia Tech (she/her)
meeting_annotations.transcript: And then of course you can always layer on, you know, doing serologic testing, doing, you know, PCR, like doing different types of of test approach on top of that to do verification and identification, but I think that if we're really looking for how do we detect spread of disease that's happening rap happening rapidly.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Audrey Ruple, Virginia Tech (she/her)
meeting_annotations.transcript: And I think that we need to take a step back and really move out of the labs and really be thinking more from a data structure, it's a data it's a data issue, not a lab lab issue.
